Paragraph.Text: a description of any physical or chemical hazard to which the food animal may have been exposed that could cause any meat product that is derived from the food animal to be contaminated;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the last 120 days of the life of a bird that has been used for breeding or egg production or in respect of the entire life of any other bird,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the mortality rate for the flock from which the bird originates,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of any disease or syndrome that was diagnosed in the flock from which the bird originates and the date on which the flock recovered from the disease or syndrome,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of any drugs administered to treat a disease or syndrome or administered as an extra-label use and of any vaccines that were administered to the bird, as well as

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: their route of administration,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the first and last date of their administration,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the dosage that was administered, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the withdrawal period or, in the case of an extra-label drug administration, a copy of the prescription that was issued by a veterinarian and an attestation by a competent person or body with respect to the withdrawal period for that administration, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of any drug that has been administered in the last 14 days that requires a withdrawal period; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of the last 180 days of the life of an equine,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name of any disease or syndrome that was diagnosed or a description of any deviation from normal behaviour, physiology or appearance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the names of any drugs and vaccines that were administered to the equine, as well as

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: their Drug Identification Numbers, if any,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: their route of administration,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: the last date of their administration,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the dosage that was administered, and

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: the withdrawal period or, in the case of an extra-label drug administration, a copy of the prescription that was issued by a veterinarian and an attestation by a competent person or body with respect to the withdrawal period for that administration, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the use of the equine.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1) and subsections 138(1) and 139(1), the licence holder may slaughter the equine or bird without having first obtained the documents referred to in subsection (1) if they notify an inspector before slaughtering the equine or bird and if, subsequent to the slaughter, the meat product that is derived from the equine or bird

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is held by the licence holder until they have obtained those documents, examined them and presented them to a veterinary inspector or to an inspector under the supervision of a veterinary inspector; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is identified as inedible.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — game animal, ostrich, rhea and emu
Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a game animal or an ostrich, rhea or emu.
The documents referred to in subsection (1) must be kept for one year after the day on which the food animal arrives at the establishment.
The holder of a licence to slaughter must prepare and keep documents that set out the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food animal that is slaughtered, the date and time that it was slaughtered and the findings of the ante-mortem examination and, if the licence holder is authorized to conduct a post-mortem examination program or a post-mortem defect management program, the findings of the post-mortem examination or the post-mortem screening and the reason for any condemnation or rejection;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food animal that is found dead at the time of its arrival at the establishment or that dies in the establishment other than by slaughter in accordance with these Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date and time that the food animal was found dead or was humanely killed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its identification number or any other information that identifies it, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the details of its disposal; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to the food animals referred to in paragraph (b), the total number per day.

Subsection.Text: The documents referred to in subsection (1) must be kept for one year after the day on which the food animal arrives at the establishment.

Section.Text: The holder of a licence to import may import an edible meat product only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign state in which the meat product is manufactured, prepared, stored, packaged or labelled, as the case may be, has, at the time the activity is conducted, an inspection system for meat products that is recognized under Part 7;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign state from which the meat product is imported has, at the time of the import, an inspection system for meat products that is recognized under Part 7;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the establishment where the food animal from which the meat product is derived was slaughtered, and any establishment where the meat product was manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, handled, tested, graded, coded, stored, packaged or labelled, have, at the time that the activity is conducted and at the time of the import, a system for manufacturing, processing, treating, preserving, handling, testing, grading, coding, slaughtering, storing, packaging or labelling, as the case may be, that is recognized under Part 7; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the licence holder provides an inspector with an official document issued by the foreign state, in a form approved by the President, that states that the meat product meets the requirements that are set out in the Act and these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: A licence holder may export an edible meat product only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence holder provides an inspector with a document that substantiates that the requirements of the foreign state to which it is intended to be exported are met in respect of that meat product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a certificate or other document is issued under section 48 of the Act in respect of that meat product.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a meat product that is subject to a notice ordering its removal from Canada under subsection 32(1) of the Act.

Section.Text: This Part does not apply in respect of the adductor muscles of scallops and the meat of geoducks.

Section.MarginalNote: Application for recognition of inspection system

Subsection.Text: A foreign state may make an application to the Minister in writing for the recognition of its inspection system for meat products or live or raw shellfish.
The application must include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an inspection system for meat products,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of the species of birds or mammals and a description of the meat products to which the system applies, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the approximate number of establishments where the manufacturing, preparing, storing, packaging or labelling of meat products that are intended to be exported to Canada would be conducted and an indication of the activities that would be conducted in those establishments;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an inspection system for live or raw shellfish, an indication of the species and the growing and harvesting areas to which the system applies;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the volume of meat products or live or raw shellfish to which the system applies that is anticipated to be exported to Canada per year;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the items set out in paragraph (3)(a) or (b), as the case may be; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title and signature of the authorized representative of the foreign state who makes the application.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must recognize the inspection system in respect of which the application is made if the system provides at least the same level of protection as that provided by the provisions of the Act and these Regulations, taking into account the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an inspection system for meat products,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any applicable legislative framework, controls and procedures,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the organizational structure of the authority that is responsible for the system,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the implementation of the system,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the resources that support the objectives of the system,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the humane treatment of the food animals that are intended to be slaughtered,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the chemical residue monitoring and microbiological monitoring of the meat products,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: the certification process for the export of the meat products, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other relevant information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an inspection system for live or raw shellfish,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any applicable legislative framework, controls and procedures,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the organizational structure of the authority that is responsible for the system,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the implementation of the system,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the resources that support the objectives of the system,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the chemical and microbiological monitoring of the shellfish, including monitoring for biotoxins,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the monitoring of the waters in the growing and harvesting areas to assess their suitability for their intended purpose, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other relevant information.

Subsection.Text: If a foreign state’s inspection system for meat products is recognized, the foreign state may make an application to the Minister in writing for the recognition of the system of manufacturing, processing, treating, preserving, handling, testing, grading, coding, slaughtering, storing, packaging or labelling that is used in an establishment and that is subject to that inspection system.
The application must include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who conducts any relevant activities and the establishment’s address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the establishment’s registration number, or another identification number for the establishment, that is provided by the foreign state;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that identifies the system in respect of which the application is made;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a declaration by the authorized representative of the foreign state who makes the application that states that the system in respect of which the application is made is subject to the foreign state’s recognized inspection system and meets the requirements of that inspection system that apply to the conduct of those activities in respect of meat products that are intended to be exported to Canada; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name, title and signature of the authorized representative of the foreign state who makes the application.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must recognize a system of manufacturing, processing, treating, preserving, handling, testing, grading, coding, slaughtering, storing, packaging or labelling in respect of which an application is made if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign state’s inspection system for the relevant meat products is recognized under subsection 170(3); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the system of manufacturing, processing, treating, preserving, handling, testing, grading, coding, slaughtering, storing, packaging or labelling is subject to the inspection system referred to in paragraph (a) and meets the requirements of that inspection system that apply to those activities in respect of meat products that are intended to be exported to Canada.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must suspend the recognition of a foreign state’s inspection system that is referred to in section 170 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign state fails to notify the Minister in writing, as soon as feasible, of any changes that it has made to the system or to the legislation governing the system; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the system no longer provides at least the same level of protection as that provided by the provisions of the Act and these Regulations.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Suspension of recognition — system used in establishment
Subsection.Text: The Minister must suspend the recognition of a system of manufacturing, processing, treating, preserving, handling, testing, grading, coding, slaughtering, storing, packaging or labelling that is referred to in section 171 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the system no longer meets the foreign state’s requirements that apply to those activities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a shipment of meat products that have been manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, handled, tested, graded, coded, stored, packaged or labelled using the system is determined to contravene a provision of the Act, these Regulations, the Food and Drugs Act or the Food and Drug Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: during the six-month period immediately prior to that shipment, there have been two other shipments of meat products that have been manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, handled, tested, graded, coded, stored, packaged or labelled using the system in respect of which such a determination of non-compliance has been made, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: among the four most recent shipments, prior to that shipment, of meat products that have been manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, handled, tested, graded, coded, stored, packaged or labelled using the system, two shipments have been determined to be non-compliant;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the system is no longer subject to the foreign state’s inspection system; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition of the foreign state’s inspection system to which the system is subject has been suspended.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must notify the foreign state in writing of the suspension under subsection (1) or (2), the grounds for the suspension and the date on which it takes effect.
The suspension takes effect on the day on which the notice is issued.
The Minister must notify the foreign state in writing that the recognition is no longer suspended if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a suspension under subsection (1) or under paragraph (2)(a), (c) or (d), the circumstances that gave rise to a suspension have been remedied; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a suspension under paragraph (2)(b), the establishment has taken corrective action.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must cancel the recognition of a foreign state’s inspection system referred to in section 170 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: no meat products or live or raw shellfish to which the system applies have been exported to Canada from the foreign state in the previous five years;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the circumstances that gave rise to a suspension have not been remedied within 12 months after the day on which the recognition was suspended; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign state requests the cancellation in writing.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Cancellation of recognition — system used in establishment
Subsection.Text: The Minister must cancel the recognition of a system of manufacturing, processing, treating, preserving, handling, testing, grading, coding, slaughtering, storing, packaging or labelling referred to in section 171 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the recognition of the inspection system to which it is subject has been cancelled;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no meat products that were manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, handled, tested, graded, coded, stored, packaged or labelled using the system have been exported to Canada from the foreign state in the previous five years;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: circumstances that gave rise to a suspension have not been remedied within 12 months after the day on which the recognition was suspended; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign state in which the establishment is located requests the cancellation in writing.

Subsection.Text: The Minister must notify the foreign state in writing of the cancellation under subsection (1) or (2), the grounds for the cancellation and the date on which it takes effect.
The cancellation takes effect on the day on which the notice is issued.

Section.Text: For the purposes of section 174, test market food means a food that,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prior to being subject to an exemption referred to in subsection 174(1), was not sold in Canada in its current form; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: differs substantially from any other food sold in Canada with respect to its composition, function, condition or packaging form.

Section.MarginalNote: Application for exemption — test market food or shortage in supply

Subsection.Text: Any person may apply, in a form approved by the President, for an exemption from the application of a provision of the Act or these Regulations for the purpose of selling a test market food or for alleviating a shortage in Canada in the available supply of a food that is manufactured, processed or produced in Canada.
The Minister may, in writing, grant the exemption if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information submitted in the application for the exemption is complete, truthful and not misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food in respect of which the application for the exemption is made meets the requirements that are set out in paragraphs 8(1)(a) to (d);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is of the opinion that no risk of injury to human health will result;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application for an exemption for the purpose of selling a test market food, the Minister is of the opinion that the exemption will not

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: confuse or mislead the public, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: disrupt the normal trading patterns of the industry or the normal food pricing patterns; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application for an exemption for the purpose of alleviating a shortage in Canada in the available supply of a food that is manufactured, processed or produced in Canada, the exemption is necessary to alleviate that shortage.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a licence to slaughter food animals and to process meat products may apply, in a form approved by the President, for an exemption from the application of section 151 in respect of a carcass or carcass side.
The Minister may, in writing, grant the exemption if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information submitted in the application for the exemption is complete, truthful and not misleading;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licence holder has established procedures

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for processing the carcass or carcass side within the establishment where the food animal was slaughtered, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for identifying the carcass or carcass side to allow it to be linked with any edible meat products derived from it and for the keeping of documents to allow for this linkage;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is of the opinion that no risk of injury to human health will result; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is of the opinion that no risk of harm to interprovincial trade or export will result.

Subsection.Text: The exemption granted under subsection (2) is subject to the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass or carcass side must be processed within the establishment where the food animal was slaughtered; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass or carcass side must be identified to allow it to be linked with any edible meat products derived from it and documents must be kept to allow for this linkage.

Section.Text: The Minister may, at any time, make any exemption referred to in subsection 174(2) or 175(2) subject to conditions.

An exemption referred to in subsection 174(2) or 175(2) is valid until the expiry date that is specified in the exemption or, if no date is specified, until the end of the period that is two years after the day on which the exemption is granted.
The Minister may cancel an exemption if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister is of the opinion that to not cancel the exemption may result in a risk of injury to human health;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an exemption referred to in subsection 175(2), the Minister is of the opinion that to not cancel the exemption may result in a risk of harm to interprovincial trade or export; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person who has been granted the exemption does not comply with any condition to which the exemption is subject or any provision of the Act or these Regulations other than a provision in respect of which the exemption is granted.

Section.MarginalNote: Definition of inspection mark in Act
Section.Text: The inspection legends that are set out in Figures 1 and 2 of Schedule 2 are prescribed for the purposes of the definition inspection mark in section 2 of the Act.

Section.MarginalNote: Edible meat products — Figure 1 of Schedule 2

Subsection.Text: A licence holder or an inspector is authorized to apply the inspection legend that is set out in Figure 1 of Schedule 2 to, and use it in connection with, an edible meat product, whether prepackaged or not, if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the meat product was manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, packaged or labelled by the licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where any meat product that it contains was manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, packaged or labelled in Canada, that activity was conducted by a licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the meat product is a livestock carcass or poultry carcass that was graded in Canada, or is derived from such a carcass, that activity was conducted by a grader in accordance with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where any meat product that it contains was imported, it was imported by a licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where the meat product, or any meat product that it contains, is derived from food animals that were slaughtered in Canada, the food animals were slaughtered by a licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the meat product complies with the standards that are set out in Volume 7 of the Standards of Identity Document and meets the requirements that are set out in paragraphs 8(1)(a) to (d) and in Division 7 of Part 6; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the inspection legend is applied or used in an establishment that is identified in the licence holder’s licence, unless the meat product is intended to be exported and the inspection legend is applied to the conveyance or used in connection with the conveyance in which the meat product is exported.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Edible meat products — Figure 2 of Schedule 2
Subsection.Text: A licence holder or an inspector is authorized to apply the inspection legend that is set out in Figure 2 of Schedule 2 to, and use it in connection with, an edible prepackaged meat product if the conditions set out in subsection (1) are met and the container of the meat product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is a hermetically sealed package that is labelled in a legible and permanent manner so as to make it possible to identify the establishment that is identified in the licence holder’s licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is a casing or bag that is closed by a clip, if the number identifying the licence holder’s establishment is legibly engraved on the clip and is visible when the clip is closed; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: bears the number identifying the licence holder’s establishment on the label except if it is shown on any part of the label that is applied or attached to the bottom of the container.

Subsection.Text: In the case of the export of a meat product under subsection 16(1), the requirements of subsections (1) and (2) must be met except any requirement that is set out in paragraph (1)(f) in the case where it is the unmet requirement referred to in subsection 16(1).

Despite paragraph (1)(f), a licence holder is authorized to apply, after the post-mortem inspection or examination and before refrigeration, in the manner set out in paragraph 151(a) or (b), the inspection legend set out in Figure 1 of Schedule 2 to a dressed beef carcass side containing dorsal root ganglia if the carcass side has been clearly marked to identify it as containing dorsal root ganglia. The dorsal root ganglia must be removed from the carcass side before any meat product derived from it is identified as edible.

Section.Text: A licence holder or an inspector is authorized to apply the inspection legend that is set out in Figure 1 of Schedule 2 to, and use it in connection with, a prepackaged processed egg product if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the processed egg product was manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, packaged or labelled by the licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the processed egg product or any processed egg product that it contains was manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, packaged or labelled in Canada, that activity was conducted by a licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the eggs from which the processed egg product is derived were processed, treated, preserved, graded, packaged or labelled in Canada, that activity was conducted by a licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the processed egg product complies with the standards that are set out in Volume 2 of the Standards of Identity Document and meets the requirements that are set out in paragraphs 8(1)(a) to (d) and in Division 4 of Part 6; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the inspection legend is applied or used in an establishment that is identified in the licence holder’s licence.

Section.Text: A licence holder or an inspector is authorized to apply the inspection legend that is set out in Figure 1 or 2 of Schedule 2 to, and use it in connection with, prepackaged fish if the following conditions are met:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the fish was manufactured, processed, treated or preserved by the licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the fish or any fish that it contains was manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, graded, packaged or labelled in Canada, that activity was conducted by a licence holder in accordance with the provisions of the Act and these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the fish complies with the standards that are set out in Volume 3 of the Standards of Identity Document and meets the requirements that are set out in paragraphs 8(1)(a) to (d) and in Division 5 of Part 6.

Section.Text: A licence holder or an inspector who applies or uses the inspection legend that is set out in Figure 1 of Schedule 2 must replace the numbers “00” with the number identifying the licence holder’s establishment.

Subsection.Text: The following persons are authorized to use the inspection legends that are set out in Figures 1 and 2 of Schedule 2:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: printers of labels, other than printers of official export labels, and manufacturers of packages, if the labels and packages that bear the inspection legend are provided to any person who is authorized under any of sections 180 to 182 to apply and use the inspection legend;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: printers of official export labels, if the labels that bear the inspection legend are provided to an inspector;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: publishers of documents on the subject of the inspection of meat products, processed egg products or fish;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: publishers of documents that advertise meat products, processed egg products or fish; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: manufacturers of stamps, if the stamps that bear the inspection legend are provided to any person who is authorized under any of sections 180 to 182 to apply and use the inspection legend.

Subsection.Text: Any person who is authorized under subsection (1) to use an inspection legend is also authorized to advertise the labels, packages, documents and stamps, as the case may be, which bear the inspection legend and to sell them.

Section.MarginalNote: Advertising and sale of certain foods
Section.Text: Any person is authorized to advertise and sell a meat product, prepackaged processed egg product or prepackaged fish to which an inspection legend has been applied or in connection with which an inspection legend is used, if the inspection legend was applied or is used in accordance with these Regulations. This includes using an inspection legend set out in Figures 1 and 2 of Schedule 2 for advertising the meat product, prepackaged processed egg product or prepackaged fish.

In the case of the inspection legend set out in Figure 1 of Schedule 2, if it is used or is to be used as a label, the number identifying the licence holder’s establishment that replaces the numbers “00” must be in characters of at least 1.6 mm in height.
A prepackaged food that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or that is imported or exported must meet the following requirements:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its package

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: must be suitable for its intended use and appropriate for the food,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: must be capable of protecting the food against moisture, loss, damage, contamination and deterioration during normal handling, storing and conveying,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: must be clean and in a sanitary condition,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: must be of sound construction,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: must be free from odours that might affect the food,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: must not impart any undesirable substance to the food,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: must not have a design or mark, or be of a colour, that enhances the appearance of the food with respect to its quality or composition, and

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: must be new, in the case of

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: a liner that is used in connection with a processed egg product,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: a package of a processed egg product, if the package is made of corrugated fibreboard,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: an egg carton of eggs that are graded in accordance with these Regulations, and

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: a tray of eggs that are graded Canada A or Canada B that is made of molded pulp;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a processed egg product, its package must, if it has previously been used and is not constructed of corrosion-resistant material, be lined with a sanitary plastic or equivalent liner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of eggs that are graded in accordance with these Regulations, its package must, if it is a plastic tray that has previously been used, be sanitized and dry before reuse; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of eggs that are graded Canada A or Canada B, its package must not have previously been used to package ungraded eggs or eggs that are graded Canada Nest Run.

Section.Text: The requirements of this Division apply in respect of any food that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or imported.

Subsection.Text: The container of a prepackaged food, including a hermetically sealed food container listed in the Standard Container Sizes Document, must be of a size that corresponds to a net quantity by weight or volume or of a maximum capacity by net weight, as the case may be, that is set out in that document and, if the hermetically sealed container is made of metal, it must be of the dimensions that correspond to the net quantity by volume that is set out in that document.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a consumer prepackaged catch-weight food if a label that bears the net weight for retail sale is applied or attached to the food.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a consumer prepackaged food that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured, prepared, produced, packaged or labelled for use by commercial or industrial enterprises or institutions without being sold by them as a consumer prepackaged food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured, prepared, produced, packaged or labelled only for sale to or by a duty-free shop; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: distributed to one or more persons for no consideration.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 3
Heading.TitleText: Standards of Fill for Processed Fruit or Vegetable Products

Section.Text: The requirements of this Division apply in respect of any foods that are sent or conveyed from one province to another, imported or exported.

Section.MarginalNote: Frozen processed fruit or vegetable products
Section.Text: At least 90% of the volume capacity of the package of a frozen processed fruit or vegetable product must be filled with the product.

Section.MarginalNote: Non-frozen processed fruit or vegetable products
Section.Text: The package of a processed fruit or vegetable product that is not frozen

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: must be filled with as much of the product as its preparation allows; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: must not contain more syrup, brine, water or other liquid packaging medium than is necessary for the processing of the product.

Section.Text: Despite section 196, a processed fruit or vegetable product that is in a hermetically sealed package must meet the requirements for minimum drained weight and average drained weight that are set out in the document entitled Minimum Drained Weights and Average Drained Weights for Processed Fruit or Vegetable Products in a Hermetically Sealed Package, prepared by the Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time.
The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: Canadian unit means a unit of measurement that is set out in Schedule II to the Weights and Measures Act. (unité canadienne)
metric unit means a unit of measurement that is set out in Schedule I to the Weights and Measures Act. (unité métrique)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 6(1) of the Act, labelling a food in a manner that is false, misleading or deceptive or is likely to create an erroneous impression includes labelling a food with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any representation in which expressions, words, figures, depictions or symbols are used, arranged or shown in a manner that may reasonably be considered to qualify the declared net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food or that is likely to deceive with respect to the net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any expression, word, number, depiction or symbol that may reasonably be considered to imply that a prepackaged food contains any matter that it does not in fact contain or that it does not contain any matter that it does in fact contain.

Subsection.MarginalNote: False, misleading or deceptive selling, importing and advertising
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 6(1) of the Act, selling, importing or advertising a food in a manner that is false, misleading or deceptive or is likely to create an erroneous impression includes selling, importing or advertising

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a consumer prepackaged food that is labelled in the manner set out in paragraph (1)(a); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a prepackaged food that is labelled in the manner set out in paragraph (1)(b).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 6(1) of the Act, labelling a consumer prepackaged food with a declaration of net quantity does not constitute labelling a food in a manner that is false, misleading or deceptive if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration meets any requirements under the Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the actual net quantity of the food is, subject to the tolerance provided under subsection (5), not less than its declared net quantity.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Declaration of net quantity — selling, importing or advertising
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 6(1) of the Act, selling, importing or advertising a consumer prepackaged food that is labelled with a declaration of net quantity does not constitute selling, importing or advertising a food in a manner that is false, misleading or deceptive if the conditions set out in paragraphs (3)(a) and (b) are met.

For the purposes of paragraph (3)(b), the tolerance for a declared net quantity that is set out in column 1 of the applicable table in Schedule 4 is the tolerance that is set out in column 2 or 3 for that net quantity.

An inspection of a lot of food, each unit of which purports to contain the same net quantity, by an inspector for the purpose of determining whether the lot meets the conditions of paragraphs 199(3)(a) and (b) must be conducted by collecting and examining a sample from the lot.

Subject to subsection (3), if a lot contains the number of units set out in column 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 5, the inspector must collect from the lot at least the number of units set out in column 2 and the units collected constitute the sample referred to in subsection (1).

If, for the purpose of determining the net quantity, other than for establishing the weight of the container, it is necessary to destroy a certain number of units in the lot, an inspector must not collect a number of units intended to be destroyed that is more than 10% of the total number of units in the lot or less than one unit, and the units collected constitute the sample referred to in subsection (1).
The lot from which a sample was collected and examined by an inspector does not meet the conditions of paragraphs 199(3)(a) and (b) if the inspector determines that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the weighted average quantity of the units in the sample, as determined by the formula set out in Part 2 of Schedule 5, is less than the declared net quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of units in the sample that contain less than the declared net quantity by more than the prescribed tolerance set out in Schedule 4 for that quantity is equal to or greater than the number set out in column 2 of Part 4 of Schedule 5 for the sample size set out in column 1 of that Part; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: two or more units in the sample contain less than the declared net quantity by more than twice the prescribed tolerance set out in Schedule 4 for that quantity.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an inspection of a consumer prepackaged food that consists of a liquid, the net quantity of the food must be determined on the basis of the assumption that the liquid is at a temperature of 20°C.

In the case of an inspection of a consumer prepackaged food that consists of a frozen liquid food and that is normally sold and consumed in a frozen state, the net quantity of the food must be determined when the food is in a frozen state.

Section.Text: A food, whether prepackaged or not, that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or that is imported or exported, and whose label bears a common name printed in boldface type, but not in italics, in the Standards of Identity Document must meet any standard that applies in respect of that common name.

It is prohibited for a person to sell a consumer prepackaged food whose label bears the word or expression “icewine” or “ice wine” or “ice-wine” or “vin de glace” or any similar word or expression, or any abbreviation of, symbol for or phonetic rendering of any of those words or expressions, unless the food meets the standard set out in Volume 8 of the Standards of Identity Document.

Section.MarginalNote: Compliance with requirements of this Part

Subsection.Text: An item of information that is shown on the label of a prepackaged food must meet any requirement of this Part that applies to that item of information, even if these Regulations do not require the food to be labelled with that item of information.
Subsection (1) applies in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an item of information referred to in Division 2, any prepackaged food that is sold in Canada and any prepackaged food that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or that is imported; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an item of information referred to in these Regulations, other than in Division 2, any food that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or that is imported or exported.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an item of information referred to in paragraphs 218(1)(a) and (b), subsection (1) also applies in respect of any dairy products, eggs, processed egg products, fish, fresh fruits or vegetables, processed fruit or vegetable products, honey, maple products or meat products that are prepackaged and exported.

Section.Text: If a provision of these Regulations requires the word “classifié” to be shown on a label, the word “classé” may be used in its place.

Subsection.Text: Any information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of a prepackaged food, other than a consumer prepackaged food, and that is not information referred to in subsection (3) must be shown on the label in at least one official language.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — words or expressions in quotation marks
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection 48(2), section 254 and subsections 256(1) and 333(2), both an English and a French word or expression that appears in quotation marks must be shown on the label of a prepackaged food except if the label of that food is authorized to show information in only one official language under subsections B.01.012(2) to (10) of the Food and Drug Regulations.
The label of a prepackaged food must bear, in both official languages,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the size designation of eggs that are graded Canada A referred to in section 316; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the colour class of maple syrup that is graded Canada Grade A or graded Grade A referred to in section 325.

Subsection.Text: The information that is required by these Regulations to be shown on the label of a consumer prepackaged food must be shown in both official languages, except in the case where the label of that food is authorized to show information in only one official language under subsections B.01.012(2) to (10) of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Words or expressions in quotation marks
Subsection.Text: A provision of these Regulations — other than paragraphs 110(a) and 111(a) — that requires a consumer prepackaged food to be labelled with words or expressions that appear in quotation marks must be read to require both an English word or expression and a French word or expression to be shown on the label of the food, except in the case where the label of that food is authorized to show information in only one official language under subsections B.01.012(2) to (10) of the Food and Drug Regulations.
Despite subsection (1), the grade name may be shown on the label of consumer prepackaged fish in only one official language.

Section.Text: For the purposes of subsections 205(2) and 206(1) and (2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expression “principal display panel” in subsections B.01.012(8) and (10) of the Food and Drug Regulations has the same meaning as in section 1 of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a reference to “these Regulations” in subsections B.01.012(2), (3), (7) and (8) of the Food and Drug Regulations must be read as a reference to “Part 11 of the Safe Food for Canadians Regulations”; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a reference to “manufactured, processed, produced or packaged”, “manufactured, processed or packaged” or “manufactured, processed, produced or packaged for resale” in the definitions local food and specialty food in subsection B.01.012(1) of the Food and Drug Regulations and in subsection B.01.012(9) of those Regulations must be read as a reference to “manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, produced or packaged”.

Section.Text: Any information that a label is required by these Regulations to bear must be clearly and prominently shown and readily discernible to the purchaser under the customary conditions of purchase and use.

If a word or expression that appears in quotation marks in these Regulations is required to be shown on a label, it may, unless otherwise provided, be shown in upper or lower case, or both, so long as it meets the legibility and character height requirements of these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: This section applies unless another provision of this Part specifies a character height for a particular item of information.
The information that a label of a consumer prepackaged food is required by this Part to bear must be shown in characters that are at least 1.6 mm in height.
That information, other than the declaration of net quantity, may be shown in characters that are at least 0.8 mm in height if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information that a label is required by Division 2 to bear is shown on the principal display panel; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the area of the principal display surface is 10 cm2 or less.

Section.Text: The height of the characters in words shown on a label must be determined by measuring

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the height of an upper case letter, if the words are shown in upper case only; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the height of the lower case letter “o”, if the words are shown in lower case or in both upper and lower case.

Subsection.Text: The requirements of this Division apply in respect of any prepackaged food that is sold in Canada, sent or conveyed from one province to another or imported.

Section 217, paragraphs 218(1)(a) and (b) and section 225 also apply in respect of any dairy products, eggs, processed egg products, fish, fresh fruits or vegetables, processed fruit or vegetable products, honey, maple products or meat products that are prepackaged and exported.

Section.Text: Sections 214 and 217 do not apply in respect of any prepackaged foods that are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: confections that are sold individually, commonly known as one-bite confections;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fresh fruits or vegetables that are packaged in a wrapper, or a confining band, that is less than 13 mm in width; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fresh fruits or vegetables that are packaged in a protective wrapper, or a protective bag, that is transparent and on which no information is shown other than a price, bar code, number code, environmental statement or product treatment symbol.

Section.Text: It is prohibited for a person to sell a prepackaged food unless a label that meets the requirements of Divisions 1 and 2 is applied or attached to the prepackaged food in the manner set out in these Regulations.
It is prohibited for a person to advertise a consumer prepackaged food unless a label is applied or attached to the food in the manner set out in Divisions 1 and 2.
It is prohibited for a person, in advertising a consumer prepackaged food, to make any representation with respect to the net quantity of the food except in the manner set out in Divisions 1 and 2.

Section.MarginalNote: Sale of prepackaged food after expiration date

Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for a person to sell a prepackaged food after the expiration date that is required to be shown on the prepackaged food’s label under Divisions 24 and 25 of Part B of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prohibition — unpackaged food or used as ingredient
Subsection.Text: It is prohibited for a person to sell the food referred to in subsection (1) as an unpackaged food or use it as an ingredient in another food.

Section.Text: A prepackaged food must have a label that meets the requirements of these Regulations applied or attached to it in the manner set out in these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: Unless otherwise provided by this Part, a label that is applied or attached to a prepackaged food must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the common name of the food, shown on the principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and principal place of business of the person by or for whom the food was manufactured, prepared, produced, stored, packaged or labelled, on any part of the label other than any part that is applied or attached to the bottom of the container of the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any other information that is required to be shown on the label of the prepackaged food in accordance with the requirements of the Food and Drug Regulations for any prepackaged product as defined in subsection B.01.001(1) of those Regulations.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Exception — name and principal place of business
Subsection.Text: The information referred to in paragraph (1)(b) may be shown on any part of the label that is applied or attached to the bottom of the container if that information is also shown on a part of the label that is not applied or attached to the bottom of the container.
The following foods are not required to be labelled with the common name:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables that are packaged in such a manner that the fresh fruits or vegetables are visible and identifiable in the container; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: consumer prepackaged fresh apples that are packaged in such a manner that the name of their variety is shown on any part of the label, except if that name is shown on any part that is applied to the bottom of the container.

Subsection.Text: In paragraph (1)(b), apple means a fresh apple for which a grade is prescribed by these Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Exception — name and principal place of business
Section.Text: Consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables that are packaged at retail in such a manner that the fresh fruits or vegetables are visible and identifiable in the container are not required to be labelled with the name and principal place of business referred to in paragraph 218(1)(b).

Section.MarginalNote: Consumer prepackaged food — declaration of net quantity
Section.Text: A label that is applied or attached to a consumer prepackaged food must bear on the principal display panel a declaration of net quantity of the food.

Section.MarginalNote: Place of manufacture — label or container
Section.Text: If the label that is applied or attached to a consumer prepackaged food bears any reference, direct or indirect, to the place of manufacture of the label or container, the reference to that place must be accompanied by an additional statement that indicates that the reference relates only to the place of manufacture of the label or container.

Subsection.Text: If a consumer prepackaged food was wholly manufactured, processed or produced in a foreign state and the name and principal place of business of the person in Canada for whom it was manufactured, processed or produced or the person by whom it was stored, packaged or labelled in Canada is shown on its label, that information must be preceded by the expressions “Imported by” and “importé par” or “Imported for” and “importé pour”, as the case may be, unless the geographic origin of the consumer prepackaged food is shown on the label in accordance with subsection (3).

If a food that was wholly manufactured, processed, produced in a foreign state is packaged in Canada, other than at retail, and the name and principal place of business of the person in Canada for whom the food was manufactured, processed, produced or packaged is shown on the label that is applied or attached to the resulting consumer prepackaged food, that information must be preceded by the expressions “Imported by” and “importé par” or “Imported for” and “importé pour”, as the case may be, unless the geographic origin of the food is shown on the label in accordance with subsection (3).
The geographic origin of a food must, subject to the requirements of any other federal or provincial law, be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in close proximity to the name and principal place of business of the person by or for whom the food was manufactured, processed or produced; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in characters of at least the same height as those in which the information referred to in paragraph (a) is shown.

Subsection.Text: If a flavouring ingredient is added to a consumer prepackaged food, the label that is applied or attached to the consumer prepackaged food must bear a statement that indicates that the flavouring ingredient is imitation, artificial or simulated if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredient is not derived from a natural substance such as meat, fish, poultry, fruits, vegetables, edible yeast, herbs, spices, bark, buds, roots, leaves or other plant material; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the label bears a pictorial representation that suggests the natural food flavour that corresponds to the added flavouring ingredient.

Subsection.Text: The statement must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on or in close proximity to the pictorial representation, if the representation is shown on the principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on the principal display panel, in close proximity to the common name, if the pictorial representation is shown on a part of the label other than the principal display panel; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: on or in close proximity to the portion of the pictorial representation shown on the principal display panel, if the representation is shown on the principal display panel and on another part of the label.

Heading.Label: SUBDIVISION E
Heading.TitleText: Requirement to Apply or Attach Label

Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged food must be applied or attached in such a manner that the label is still applied or attached at the time it is sold.
Subject to section 228, the label of a consumer prepackaged food that is for sale must be applied or attached to the container in accordance with section 227.

Subsection.Text: All or part of the label of a consumer prepackaged food must be applied to the principal display surface.
Despite subsection (1), in the case of a consumer prepackaged food whose container is an ornamental container, the label may be applied to the bottom of the container or attached to the container.

Section.Text: In the case of a consumer prepackaged food whose container is mounted on a display card, the label may be applied to the surface of the display card that is displayed or visible under customary conditions of sale or use.

Subsection.Text: In the case of the label of a consumer prepackaged food, the following must be shown in characters of at least the minimum character height that is set out in column 2 of Schedule 6 for the area of a principal display surface that is set out in column 1:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the numerical quantity in the declaration of net quantity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the statement referred to in section 224 that indicates that a flavouring ingredient is imitation, artificial or simulated.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Container mounted on display card — specific case
Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), in the case of a container that is mounted on a display card, the reference to “Area of Principal Display Surface” in Schedule 6 must be read as “Total Area of the Surface of the Display Card that is Displayed or Visible under Customary Conditions of Sale or Use”, if the information is shown on a label that is applied to all or part of that surface.

Despite paragraph (1)(a), in the case of consumer prepackaged wine, the numerical quantity in the declaration of net quantity may, if the net quantity is 750 mL, the container is no taller than 360 mm and the area of the principal display surface is greater than 258 cm2, be shown in characters of a height less than the minimum character height that is set out in column 2 of Schedule 6, but must be shown in characters that are at least 3.3 mm in height.

Heading.Label: SUBDIVISION G
Heading.TitleText: Manner of Showing Declaration of Net Quantity

Section.Text: The declaration of net quantity that is shown on the label of a consumer prepackaged food must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be in distinct contrast to any other information or pictorial representation on the label; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: show the numerical quantity in boldface type.

Heading.TitleText: Declaration by Volume, Weight or Numerical Count

Section.Text: The declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a consumer prepackaged food that is listed in the document entitled Units of Measurement for the Net Quantity Declaration of Certain Foods, prepared by the Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time, by volume, weight or numerical count in accordance with that document; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a consumer prepackaged food that is not listed in the document referred to in paragraph (a),

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the food is liquid, gas or viscous, by food volume, or, if the food is solid, by weight, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the established trade practice in respect of the food is to show its net quantity in a manner that is different than what is required by subparagraph (i), in accordance with that established trade practice.

Section.Text: The declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food must be shown in metric units, unless otherwise provided by these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The metric units that must be shown in a declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food must be in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: millilitres, if the net volume of the food is less than 1 000 mL;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: litres, if the net volume of the food is 1 000 mL or more;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: grams, if the net weight of the food is less than 1 000 g; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: kilograms, if the net weight of the food is 1 000 g or more.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraphs (1)(a) and (c), 500 mL may be shown as 0.5 L and 500 g may be shown as 0.5 kg.

In the case referred to in paragraph (1)(c), the net weight may be shown as a decimal fraction of a kilogram if the food is packaged from bulk at retail or is a catch-weight food that is sold by a retailer.
If the declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food is shown in metric units, it must be shown in the decimal system to three figures.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Net quantity below 100 g or mL
Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if the net quantity is below 100 g or 100 mL, it may be shown to two figures.
Despite subsections (1) and (2), any final zero appearing to the right of the decimal point is not required to be shown.

Section.Text: If the declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food is shown in metric units and the quantity is less than one metric unit, the quantity must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in words; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the decimal system, with a zero preceding the decimal point.

Section.Text: If the declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food is shown in metric units and Canadian units, those units must be grouped together, except that any symbol or pictogram that is shown in accordance with the Canada Consumer Product Safety Act or any regulations made under that Act may be shown between those units.

Subsection.Text: If the declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food whose volume is less than one gallon includes Canadian units, those units must be in fluid ounces, except that 20 fluid ounces may be shown as one pint, 40 fluid ounces as one quart, 60 fluid ounces as three pints, 80 fluid ounces as two quarts or as one-half gallon and 120 fluid ounces as three quarts.

Despite subsection (1), in the case of oysters that are sold in the shell, other than those in a hermetically sealed package, the declaration of net quantity must, if shown by volume, be shown in bushels or pecks.

Heading.TitleText: Individually Packaged Food Sold as One Unit and Servings

Section.MarginalNote: Individually packaged food sold as one unit

Subsection.Text: If a consumer prepackaged food is sold as one unit but consists of two or more individually packaged foods that are labelled with the information required for a consumer prepackaged food, the declaration of net quantity of the consumer prepackaged food being sold as one unit must show

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the number of individually packaged foods in each class of food, as well as the common name of the food in each class; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the total net quantity of the individually packaged foods in each class, or the net quantity of each identical individually packaged food in each class.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Dairy products sold as one unit
Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in the case of a dairy product that is sold as one unit but consists of two or more individual packages of butter patties, butter reddies or other related dairy products if the total net quantity of the individual packages is 20 g or less.

In the case of prepackaged honey that is graded and that is sold as one unit but that consists of two or more individual packages, the label must bear the number of those packages and the net quantity of each, in metric units.

Section.MarginalNote: Prohibition — representation respecting number of servings
Section.Text: It is prohibited for a person to apply or attach to any consumer prepackaged food a label that bears any representation with respect to the number of servings contained in the consumer prepackaged food unless the label bears a declaration of net quantity of each serving in accordance with section 241.

Subsection.Text: The declaration of net quantity of a serving of a consumer prepackaged food must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in close proximity to the representation with respect to the number of servings contained in the consumer prepackaged food; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in characters of the same height as those in which that representation is shown.

Subsection.Text: The declaration of net quantity of a serving must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the requirements of sections 231 and 233 to 237 respecting the declaration of net quantity of the food; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in metric units, unless otherwise provided by these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: If the representation with respect to the number of servings is made in terms of cups or tablespoons,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: one cup is equivalent to 250 mL and one tablespoon is equivalent to 15 mL; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the declaration of net quantity is not required to meet the requirements of paragraph (2)(b).

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in the case of a prepackaged food that bears a nutrition facts table that contains the serving size of the food in accordance with the Food and Drug Regulations.

Section.Text: If the declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food or of a serving of the food is shown in metric units and Canadian units, the net quantity in an advertisement may be shown in either a metric unit or a Canadian unit.

Section.MarginalNote: Exceptions to declaration of net quantity
Section.Text: In addition to the exceptions in section 299, the following consumer prepackaged foods are not required to be labelled with the declaration of net quantity referred to in section 221:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual portion of a food that is prepared by a commissary and sold by an automatic vending machine or a mobile canteen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a catch-weight food that is sold to a retailer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an individual portion of a food that is sold by a restaurant or other commercial enterprise if it is served with meals or snacks; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables sold in a retail store that are packaged in an unsealed transparent protective bag, if sold by weight.

Section.Text: The requirements of sections 216, 221 and 240 do not apply in respect of consumer prepackaged raspberries or strawberries that are packaged in the field in a container that has a capacity of 1.14 L or less.

Subsection.Text: A declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food that is an individually measured food is not required to meet the legibility and character height requirements of subsection 210(2), paragraph 229(1)(a), subsections 229(2) and (3) and paragraph 230(b).

If it is clearly shown on the principal display panel in Canadian units, the declaration of net quantity of a consumer prepackaged food, other than an individually measured food, that is packaged from bulk at retail, is not required to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meet the legibility and character height requirements of subsection 210(2), paragraph 229(1)(a), subsections 229(2) and (3) and paragraph 230(b); or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in metric units.

Subsection.Text: In this section, individually measured means, with respect to a food, that the food is measured and packaged in a manner other than in accordance with a predetermined fixed quantity and, as a result, is sold in varying quantities.

Section.MarginalNote: Individually packaged food sold as one unit
Section.Text: Sections 221, 239 and 240 do not apply to the label of a consumer prepackaged food that consists of six or less identical individually packaged foods but is sold as one unit if each of the individually packaged foods is labelled with the information required by this Part and that information is clearly visible at the time of sale.
The requirements of this Division apply in respect of any food that is sent or conveyed from one province to another, imported or exported.
The requirements relating to the declaration of net quantity that are set out in this Division do not apply in respect of a consumer prepackaged food.

Any declaration of net quantity that is required by this Division must be shown by volume, weight or numerical count in accordance with the document entitled Units of Measurement for the Net Quantity Declaration of Certain Foods, prepared by the Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time.

Section.MarginalNote: Declaration of net quantity — prepackaged foods
Section.Text: The label of the following prepackaged foods must bear a declaration of net quantity:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: dairy products;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: eggs graded in accordance with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fish;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: fresh fruits or vegetables;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: processed fruit or vegetable products;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: honey graded in accordance with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: maple products, except maple syrup that is not graded in accordance with these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: edible meat products.

Section.Text: Unless otherwise provided by these Regulations, the declaration of net quantity must be shown in metric units.
Despite section 244.2, the declaration of net quantity must be,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prepackaged dairy product,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in metric units or Canadian units, or both (in which case the units must be grouped together), if a standard is set out in Volume 1 of the Standards of Identity Document for the dairy product, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in metric units, if no standard is set out in Volume 1 of the Standards of Identity Document for the dairy product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of fresh fruits or vegetables, in metric units or Canadian units, or both (in which case the units must be grouped together), unless the declaration of net quantity is shown by numerical count.

Section.Text: The declaration of net quantity must be shown on the principal display panel of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged dairy products;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fish that is in a hermetically sealed package and commercially sterile;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged processed fruit or vegetable products; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged edible meat products.

Section.Text: In the case of prepackaged edible meat products, the declaration of net quantity must be shown in the manner required by sections 233 to 236 and 239 as if it were a consumer prepackaged food.

Subsection.Text: A label that bears the information required by this Division in respect of a food must be applied or attached

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prepackaged food, to its container; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of food that is not prepackaged, to the food.

Subsection.Text: The information may be shown on any part of the label, unless otherwise provided by this Division in respect of the food.
Despite subsection (2), if the information is shown on any part of the label that is applied or attached to the bottom of the prepackaged food or container, that information must also be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on any part of the label where it is required to be shown under another provision of this Division in respect of the food; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if paragraph (a) does not apply, on any part of the label that is not applied or attached to the bottom of the food or container.

Section.Text: The principal display panel of a prepackaged dairy product must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of butter, calorie-reduced butter, light butter or lite butter, dairy spread and whey butter, the following words or expressions:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: “Cultured” or “de culture”, preceding the common name in English or following the common name in French, if the dairy product has been prepared from cream to which a bacterial culture has been added,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: “Whipped” or “fouetté”, preceding the common name in English or following the common name in French, if the dairy product has had air or inert gas uniformly incorporated into it as a result of whipping,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: “Unsalted” or “non salé”, in close proximity to the common name, if the dairy product is unsalted and has not been cultured, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: “Salted” or “salé”, in close proximity to the common name, if the dairy product is salted and has been cultured;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a combination of skim milk powder and whey powder, the percentage of each powder; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of partly skimmed milk powder, dairy spread and calorie-reduced butter, the percentage of milk fat.

Section.MarginalNote: Prepackaged dairy products — not consumer prepackaged
Section.Text: The principal display panel of a prepackaged dairy product, other than a consumer prepackaged dairy product, must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cheese in its original shape, made from pasteurized milk, the word “Pasteurized” or “pasteurisé”, unless the list of ingredients indicates that the cheese is made from pasteurized milk;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of buttermilk powder, the percentage of milk fat;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of skim milk powder that has a whey protein nitrogen content of not less than 6.0 mg/g, the expression “Low Heat” or “Low Temperature” or “basse température” or the abbreviation “Low Temp.” or “basse temp.”; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of skim milk powder that has a whey protein nitrogen content of not more than 1.5 mg/g, the expression “High Heat” or “High Temperature” or “haute température” or the abbreviation “High Temp.” or “haute temp.”.

Section.Text: The principal display panel of a consumer prepackaged dairy product must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cheese, except cottage cheese and creamed cottage cheese, and in the case of cheese curd, the percentage of moisture;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of cheese, cheese curd and evaporated partly skimmed milk or concentrated partly skimmed milk, the percentage of milk fat; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a dairy product that consists of or was manufactured or prepared wholly or partly from milk that is obtained from an animal other than a cow, the source of the milk, unless the source is indicated in the common name.

Subsection.Text: The principal display panel of a consumer prepackaged cheese must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the relative firmness of the cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of a soft white cheese, the principal ripening characteristic of the cheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a mixture of grated or shredded cheeses, the varieties of the cheeses, in descending order of their proportion in the mixture.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: cheddar cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: cream cheese with or without added ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: cream cheese spread with or without added ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: whey cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: processed cheese with or without added ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: processed cheese food with or without added ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: processed cheese spread with or without added ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: cold-pack cheese with or without added ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: cold-pack cheese food with or without added ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: cottage cheese;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: creamed cottage cheese; and

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: any cheese that is listed in Part I or II of the table to section 7.4.1 of Volume 7 of the Food Compositional Standards Document.

Subsection.Text: The relative firmness of the cheese must be identified by the expressions that correspond to the applicable moisture on fat-free basis content set out in the Descriptive Words, Expressions and Identification Names Document.

The principal ripening characteristic of the cheese must be identified by the words or expressions that correspond to the applicable ripening process set out in the Descriptive Words, Expressions and Identification Names Document.
The label of the following dairy products must bear the expression “Product of” or “produit de”, followed by the name of the foreign state of origin:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an imported prepackaged dairy product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a consumer prepackaged cheese that is packaged in Canada from imported bulk cheese for which a standard is set out in Volume 1 of the Standards of Identity Document.

Subsection.Text: In the case of the cheese referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the information must be shown on the principal display panel.

Section.Text: Subsection 239(2) and sections 244.3, 246, 248 and 250 do not apply in respect of an individual portion of a consumer prepackaged dairy product that is sold

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by means of an automatic vending machine or mobile canteen; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by a restaurant or other commercial enterprise if it is served with meals or snacks.

Section.Text: The information that is required by section 250 must be shown in boldface type in characters that are at least 16 mm in height, in the case of a prepackaged dairy product other than a consumer prepackaged dairy product.
