The label of prepackaged eggs that are graded in accordance with these Regulations and that are pasteurized in the shell must bear the words “Pasteurized” and “pasteurisé”, as well as the expressions “Graded Canada A Before Pasteurization” and “classifié Canada A avant pasteurisation” or the expressions “Graded Grade A Before Pasteurization” and “classifié catégorie A avant pasteurisation”, as the case may be.

Subsection.Text: The label of imported prepackaged eggs must bear the expressions “Product of” and “produit de”, followed by the name of the foreign state of origin.
That information must be shown in characters that are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton, on the top or side of the tray or egg carton, at least 1.5 mm in height; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a container other than a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton, at least 6 mm in height.

Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged processed egg product must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the inspection legend set out in Figure 1 of Schedule 2, if the prepackaged processed egg product is sent or conveyed from one province to another or exported; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the official inspection mark of the foreign state of origin, if the prepackaged processed egg product is imported.

Section.Text: The label of an imported prepackaged processed egg product must also bear the expression “Product of” or “produit de”, followed by the name of the foreign state of origin.
The label of the following prepackaged processed egg products must bear the expression “Product of Canada and” or “produit du Canada et”, followed by the name of the foreign state of origin:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: dried whole egg that is a blend of imported and Canadian dried whole egg;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: dried yolk that is a blend of imported and Canadian dried yolk; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: dried egg white or dried albumen that is a blend of imported and Canadian dried egg white or dried albumen.

Section.Text: In this Subdivision, salted fish means fish of the Gadidae family that has been preserved by salt and that has a salt content of 12% or more by wet weight and a moisture content of not more than 65%.

Subsection.Text: The label of prepackaged fish must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of bivalve molluscs in the shell that are not in a hermetically sealed package, the date of processing and an expression, code or identifier that indicates the area from which they were harvested; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of tuna that is in a hermetically sealed package, one of the expressions to describe the applicable colour of the fish flesh based on the indicated condition as set out in the Descriptive Words, Expressions and Identification Names Document.

Subsection.Text: In the case of prepackaged salted fish, if the label bears one of the expressions set out in the Descriptive Words, Expressions and Identification Names Document to describe the salted fish, the applicable salt or moisture content after salting is complete as indicated for that expression must be met.

Section.MarginalNote: Prepackaged fish placed in a second container
Section.Text: If prepackaged fish that is labelled in accordance with this Part is placed inside of a second container and the resulting product is prepackaged fish, other than consumer prepackaged fish, the second container is not required to be labelled with the declaration of net quantity referred to in paragraph 244.1(c).
The label of imported prepackaged fish must bear the name of the foreign state of origin.

Subsection.Text: The label of prepackaged fresh apples must bear the name of the variety.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prepackaged apples placed in second container
Subsection.Text: If prepackaged fresh apples that are labelled in accordance with this Part are placed inside of a second container and the resulting product is prepackaged fresh apples, other than consumer prepackaged fresh apples, the second container is not required to be labelled with the name of the variety.
In this section, apple means a fresh apple for which a grade is prescribed by these Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Imported prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables

Subsection.Text: The expression “Product of” or “Produce of” or “produit de”, “Grown in” or “cultivé dans” or “Country of Origin” or “pays d’origine”, followed by the name of the foreign state in which the fresh fruits or vegetables were grown, or other words that clearly indicate that foreign state, must be shown on the principal display panel of imported prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables in close proximity to the declaration of net quantity or the grade name.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Prepackaged fruits or vegetables — second container
Subsection.Text: If prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables that are labelled in accordance with this Part are placed inside of a second container and the resulting product is prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, other than consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, the second container is not required to be labelled with the information referred to in subsection (1) if that information is easily visible and legible without having to open the second container and that information is not obscured by the container.
This section applies whether or not the imported prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables are subsequently repackaged in Canada.

The information that is required by section 269 must be shown in boldface type in characters of at least the minimum character height that is set out in column 2 of Schedule 6 for the area of a principal display surface that is set out in column 1.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables that are packaged from bulk at retail or that are catch-weight foods sold by a retailer.

Section.Text: Despite subsection 270(1), in the case of prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, other than consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, whose container is a reusable plastic container, the characters must be at least 1.6 mm in height.

Section.MarginalNote: Prepackaged processed fruit or vegetable products
Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged processed fruit or vegetable product must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expression “Contents ... Per Cent Slack Filled” or “... pour cent du contenant non rempli” or “Contents ... Per Cent Short Weight” or “contient ... pour cent de moins que le poids indiqué”, if the package is not filled to capacity or contains less than the minimum drained weight and average drained weight as set out in the document entitled Minimum Drained Weights and Average Drained Weights for Processed Fruit or Vegetable Products in a Hermetically Sealed Package, prepared by the Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the expression “Keep Refrigerated” or “garder réfrigéré”, in the case of sauerkraut with preservative, or a fruit juice that is in a non-hermetically sealed package.

Section.MarginalNote: Identification name — food in syrup or juice
Section.Text: A food that is set out in the Descriptive Words, Expressions and Identification Names Document that is frozen or in a hermetically sealed package and that is packaged in syrup, fruit juice, or in fruit juice to which sugar has been added, must be labelled with the identification name that is set out for the corresponding percentage of soluble solids contained in the applicable food.

Subsection.Text: The label of an imported prepackaged processed fruit or vegetable product must bear the name of the foreign state where the processed fruit or vegetable product was packaged.
The name must be shown in characters that are at least 1.6 mm in height.
Despite subsection (2), if the product was packaged for a Canadian importer under the importer’s private label, the name must be shown in characters that are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at least 6.4 mm in height, if the declaration of net quantity is more than 283.5 g; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at least 3.2 mm in height, if the declaration of net quantity is 283.5 g or less.

Section.Text: The label of prepackaged honey that is produced in Canada and graded in accordance with these Regulations must bear the expression “Product of Canada” or “produit du Canada” or “Canadian Honey” or “miel canadien”.

Subsection.Text: The label of imported prepackaged honey must bear the expression “Product of” or “produit de” followed by the name of the foreign state of origin.
In the case of imported prepackaged honey, other than consumer prepackaged honey, that information must be shown in characters that are at least 9.5 mm in height.

Section.Text: The label of consumer prepackaged honey that was packaged from imported honey and graded in accordance with these Regulations must bear the expressions “Product of” and “produit de” followed by the name of the foreign state of origin.

Section.MarginalNote: Blend of Canadian and imported honey

Subsection.Text: The label of prepackaged honey that is a blend of imported honey and Canadian honey and that is graded in accordance with these Regulations must bear the expression “A Blend of Canadian and (naming the foreign state or states of origin) Honey” or “mélange de miel canadien et de miel (indication de l’État étranger ou des États étrangers d’origine)” or “A Blend of (naming the foreign state or states of origin) Honey and Canadian Honey” or “mélange de miel (indication de l’État étranger ou des États étrangers d’origine) et de miel canadien”.
The states of origin, Canadian or foreign, must be shown in descending order of the proportion of honey from each state.

Section.Text: The label of the following maple products must bear the name of the foreign state of origin:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any imported prepackaged maple syrup whose net quantity is 5 L or less; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any other imported prepackaged maple product whose net quantity is 5 kg or less.

Section.MarginalNote: Inspection legend — non-prepackaged edible meat products

Subsection.Text: An edible meat product that is not prepackaged must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the inspection legend set out in Figure 1 of Schedule 2, if the edible meat product is sent or conveyed from one province to another or exported; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the official inspection mark of the foreign state of origin, if the edible meat product is imported.

Subsection.Text: If an inspection legend or official inspection mark of a foreign state is applied directly on an edible meat product, the transverse axis passing through the centre of the legend or mark must be at least 25 mm in length.
A label must be applied or attached to an edible meat product that is not prepackaged, and must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the information required by paragraphs 218(1)(a) and (b) and 244.1(h) and sections 244.5 and 286 shown on the principal display panel;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredients listed in descending order of their proportion by weight of the product; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the components of the ingredients,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: listed immediately after the ingredient of which they are components, in such a manner as to indicate that they are components of that ingredient,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: listed in descending order of their proportion by weight of the ingredient determined before they are combined to form the ingredient, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: shown in accordance with sections B.01.009 and B.01.010 of the Food and Drug Regulations.

Subsection.Text: If one or more components of an ingredient is shown in a list of ingredients, the ingredient is not required to be shown in the list if all of the components of the ingredient are shown in the list by their common names and in accordance with paragraph (1)(b) as if they were ingredients.

Section.MarginalNote: Exception — omission or substitution of ingredient or component

Subsection.Text: In the case where it is an acceptable manufacturing practice for a licence holder to omit, from an edible meat product that is not prepackaged, any food that is ordinarily an ingredient of the meat product or a component of the ingredient, or substitute in whole or in part, in an edible meat product that is not prepackaged, any food for a food that is ordinarily an ingredient or a component of the ingredient, the list of ingredients on the label of the meat product may, for the 12‑month period beginning at the time the label is applied or attached to the edible meat product, show as ingredients of the meat product or components of the ingredients the food that may be omitted or substituted, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: all the foods that may be used as ingredients or components throughout the 12‑month period are shown in the list of ingredients;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is clearly stated as part of the list of ingredients that the food shown as an ingredient or component may not be present in the meat product or that another food may be substituted; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food that may be omitted or substituted is grouped with foods of the same class of foods that are used as ingredients or components in the product and the foods within each of the groups of foods are listed in descending order of the proportion by weight in which they are likely to be used during the 12‑month period.

Subsection.Text: In the case where it is an acceptable manufacturing practice for a licence holder to vary the proportions of ingredients of an edible meat product that is not prepackaged or components of the ingredients, the list of ingredients on the label of the edible meat product may, for the 12‑month period beginning at the time the label is applied or attached to the meat product, show the ingredients or components in the same proportions throughout the 12‑month period, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is clearly stated as part of the list of ingredients that the proportions indicated are subject to change; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the ingredients or components are listed in descending order of the proportion by weight in which they are likely to be used during the 12‑month period.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in sections 283 and 284.

Definition.Text: component means an individual unit of food that is combined as an individual unit of food with one or more other individual units of food to form an ingredient. (constituant)

ingredient means an individual unit of food that is combined as an individual unit of food with one or more other individual units of food to form an integral unit of food that is an edible meat product. (ingrédient)

Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged edible meat product must bear on the principal display panel a statement that indicates that the meat product must be kept refrigerated or kept frozen, as the case may be, unless the meat product

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is in a hermetically sealed package and is commercially sterile;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is dried to attain a water activity of 0.85 or less;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has a pH of 4.6 or less;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is packaged in salt or a saturated salt solution; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: is fermented and has a pH of 5.3 or less, and a water activity of 0.90 or less, at the end of the fermentation.

Section.MarginalNote: Inspection legend — prepackaged edible meat products

Subsection.Text: The label of a prepackaged edible meat product must also bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the inspection legend set out in Figure 1 or 2 of Schedule 2, if the prepackaged edible meat product is sent or conveyed from one province to another or exported; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the official inspection mark of the foreign state of origin, if the prepackaged edible meat product is imported.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a prepackaged edible meat product, other than a consumer prepackaged meat product, the principal display panel must bear the inspection legend or the official inspection mark of the foreign state of origin.

Despite subsection (2), in the case of a prepackaged edible meat product, other than a consumer prepackaged meat product, the inspection legend or the official inspection mark of the foreign state of origin may be shown on the tamper-resistant seal, if such a seal is used, unless that seal is applied to the bottom of the container.

Section.Text: The label of an edible meat product may describe the meat product as, or as being derived from, a carcass or part of a carcass or a cut, organ or tissue of a food animal only if the label bears the name of the animal species, as it is commonly known, from which the meat product was derived.

Subsection.Text: The label of an edible meat product may bear a word or expression that indicates or suggests that it is a ready-to-eat product only if the requirements of section 47 are met in respect of the edible meat product.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Cooked or fully cooked edible meat product
Subsection.Text: The label may also bear the word or expression “Cooked” or “Fully Cooked” provided the word or expression is in close proximity to the common name and the product has been subjected to heat for a time sufficient to produce the characteristics of a cooked meat product in respect of friability, colour, texture and flavour.

Section.Text: The label of a prepackaged edible meat product that is not a ready-to-eat product but could be mistaken for one must bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the expression “Must Be Cooked” or “doit être cuit” or “Raw Product” or “produit cru” or the word “Uncooked” or “non cuit”, or any equivalent word or expression, on the principal display panel, in close proximity to the common name, to indicate that the meat product requires cooking before consumption; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: comprehensive cooking instructions — such as a combination of internal temperature and cooking time — that, if followed, will result in a ready-to-eat meat product.

Section.Text: In the case of a prepackaged poultry carcass, if the carcass is dressed or partially dressed and has been graded, the common name must be shown on

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the part of the package that lies on or over the anterior centre of the breast of the poultry, if the carcass is individually packaged; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on a tag that is attached to the V of the wishbone of the poultry carcass, if it is not individually packaged.

Section.Text: In the case of a consumer prepackaged poultry carcass, if the carcass is dressed or partially dressed, has been graded in accordance with these Regulations and has been seasoned, the label must bear the words “Seasoned” and “assaisonné”.

In the case of a prepackaged poultry carcass, if the carcass is dressed or partially dressed, has been graded in accordance with these Regulations, and is not individually packaged, a tag must be attached to the V of the wishbone of the poultry carcass that bears the name and principal place of business of the person by or for whom the poultry carcass was packaged.

Section.MarginalNote: Label of edible meat products — exception

Subsection.Text: An edible meat product whose label does not meet the requirements of these Regulations may be sent or conveyed from an establishment that is identified in a licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is a prepackaged meat product, other than a consumer prepackaged meat product, that is sealed with a tamper-resistant seal or it is in a conveyance that is sealed with a tamper-resistant seal;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is sent or conveyed to another establishment where meat products are manufactured, processed, treated, preserved, graded, packaged or labelled by a licence holder; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: it is accompanied by

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a document from the licence holder that states that the meat product is identified as edible under section 125, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of ingredients that meets the requirements of the Food and Drug Regulations that apply in respect of a prepackaged product as defined in subsection B.01.001(1) of those Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The tamper-resistant seal on the prepackaged meat product or conveyance must not be broken until after the meat product arrives at the other establishment.
The label of an imported edible meat product must bear the expression “Product of” or “produit de”, followed by the name of the foreign state of origin, in close proximity to the common name.
The information must, whether or not the edible meat product is a consumer prepackaged meat product, be shown in characters of the height required by subsections 210(2) and (3).
This section applies whether or not the imported edible meat product is subsequently packaged or labelled in Canada without being manufactured or prepared in Canada.

Section.Text: In the case of an imported consumer prepackaged poultry carcass, if the carcass is dressed or partially dressed and has been graded in accordance with these Regulations, the information required by subsection 297(1) must be shown in the same colour as the grade name.
Paragraphs 199(1)(a) and 199(2)(a), subsections 199(3) to (5) and sections 200, 216, 221 to 224 and 229 to 241 do not apply in respect of a consumer prepackaged food that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured, prepared, produced, packaged or labelled for use by commercial or industrial enterprises or institutions without being sold by them as a consumer prepackaged food;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: manufactured, prepared, produced, packaged or labelled only for sale to or by a duty-free shop; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: distributed to one or more persons for no consideration.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: beef carcass has the same meaning as in the Grades Document. (carcasse de boeuf)
bison carcass has the same meaning as in the Grades Document. (carcasse de bison)
grader means a person designated as a grader under subsection 13(3) of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Act for the purposes of the Act. (classificateur)
grade roller means a tool that is used to apply a roller brand on each side of a livestock carcass. (rouleau à estampiller)

Grades Document means the document entitled Beef, Bison and Veal Carcass Grade Requirements, prepared by the Canadian Beef Grading Agency and published on its website, as amended from time to time. (Document de classification)
grade stamp means a mark that is applied to a livestock carcass and that shows the grade name and the grader’s code. (cachet de classification)
grade stamp applicator means a tool that is used to apply a grade stamp or a yield stamp to a livestock carcass. (applicateur de cachet de classification)
grading stand means a platform that is used for grading livestock carcasses. (plate-forme de classification)
identification code means a distinct code that is applied to a food animal before slaughter and grading to enable the food animal to be traced. (code d’identification)

knife-rib means to cut the left side, or the left and right sides, of a beef carcass or bison carcass in the following locations by severing the vertebrae and cutting 15 cm or more beyond the longissimus muscles in order to expose those muscles for evaluation by a grader:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a beef carcass, between the 12th and 13th ribs; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a bison carcass, between the 11th and 12th ribs. (incision transversale)

Definition.Text: lot means a group of food animals or a quantity of livestock carcasses that, for any reason, is considered together for inspection. (lot)
marketing agency means a board or commission that is established under an Act of a province that regulates the marketing of bovine or ovine animals. (office de commercialisation)
meat inspection stamp means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an inspection legend that is prescribed under section 179 in respect of a meat product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a mark that is authorized under an Act of a province to be applied to or used in connection with a livestock carcass or poultry carcass after inspection. (cachet d’inspection de viande)

Definition.Text: musculature means the size and shape of the muscles of a livestock carcass. (musculature)
ovine carcass has the same meaning as in the Compendium. (carcasse d’ovin)
primal cut means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a beef carcass or bison carcass, the round, sirloin, short loin, rib or chuck of the carcass side; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an ovine carcass or veal carcass, the leg, loin or foresaddle of the carcass side. (coupe primaire)

Definition.Text: producer means any person who sells livestock for slaughter. (producteur)
provincial establishment means an establishment

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that is registered under an Act of a province that regulates the inspection of livestock carcasses or poultry carcasses; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where livestock carcasses or poultry carcasses are prepared by any person who is authorized to do so under an Act of a province that regulates the inspection of those carcasses. (établissement provincial)

Definition.Text: roller brand means the mark that is applied to a beef carcass and that shows the grade name and the number that is assigned to the establishment where the livestock carcass is graded. (marque d’estampillage)
sub-primal cut means a cut of meat that is greater than 125 cm3 and that is derived from a beef carcass or a primal cut of a beef carcass. (coupe sous-primaire)
trim means to remove all or part of the external fat from a livestock carcass. (parer)
veal carcass has the same meaning as in the Grades Document. (carcasse de veau)

weighmaster means an employee of an establishment that is identified in a licence or of a provincial establishment who is trained to operate a scale that is approved under section 3 of the Weights and Measures Act. (peseur)
yield class has the same meaning as in the Compendium or the Grades Document. (catégorie de rendement)
yield stamp has the same meaning as in the Compendium or the Grades Document. (cachet de rendement)

Section.Text: For the purposes of the definition grade name in section 2 of the Act, the grade names that are set out in the Compendium and in the Grades Document are prescribed in respect of foods.

Subsection.Text: Any eggs, fish, fresh fruits or vegetables, processed fruit or vegetable products, honey, maple syrup or beef carcass in respect of which grades are prescribed by these Regulations that are sent or conveyed from one province to another or that are imported or exported must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be graded;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements that are set out in the Compendium or the Grades Document in respect of the applicable grade of that food; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: be labelled, in accordance with the Compendium or the Grades Document, with the applicable grade name that is set out in the Compendium or the Grades Document.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: frozen gutted Pacific salmon;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: fresh fruits or vegetables that are exported;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: fresh blueberries, fresh cantaloupes, fresh crabapples, fresh cranberries, fresh field rhubarb and fresh strawberries;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if they are in a hermetically sealed package, mixed vegetables (macédoine), stewed tomatoes, tomato puree, tomato pulp, tomato paste, tomato ketchup and tomato chili sauce;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a beef carcass, or a carcass side, hind quarter, front quarter, primal cut or sub-primal cut of a beef carcass that has been imported, in the following cases:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is prepackaged, its container is labelled with the expression “Ungraded Beef” or “boeuf non classifié”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is not prepackaged, it is accompanied by documents for presentation to an inspector or grader that show that it has not been graded; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a beef carcass, or a carcass side, hind quarter, front quarter, primal cut or sub-primal cut of a beef carcass, that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or exported, in the following cases:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is prepackaged, its container is labelled with the expression “Ungraded Beef” or “boeuf non classifié”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if it is not prepackaged, it is accompanied by documents for presentation to an inspector or grader that show that it has not been graded.

Subsection.Text: Paragraphs (1)(b) and (c) do not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any processed fruit or vegetable product that does not meet the requirements of the Regulations with respect to grade and that is sent or conveyed from one province to another, if it is labelled with the words “Substandard” or “sous-régulier”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: honey that does not meet the requirements of the Regulations with respect to grade and that is sent or conveyed from one province to another, if it is labelled with the words “Substandard” or “sous-régulier”; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: honey that does not meet the requirements of the Regulations with respect to grade and that is exported, if the information on the label or the container with respect to the quality of the honey is not false, misleading or deceptive or is not likely to create an erroneous impression.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph 1(c) does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a food that is imported, if the Compendium indicates that it must be labelled with a grade designation that is established by the foreign state of origin and the imported food is labelled with that grade designation rather than with a grade name, and the grade name must be shown in accordance with sections 205, 206 and 312 as if it were a grade name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables that are imported, sold in their original container and labelled with a grade designation that is established by the foreign state of origin, if they meet the requirements of the foreign state in respect of that grade designation and those requirements are substantially equivalent to any requirements that apply under these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: imported prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, other than consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, if they are graded and meet the requirements of the Compendium in respect of that grade;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a beef carcass, or a carcass side, hind quarter, front quarter, primal cut or sub-primal cut of a beef carcass, that is not prepackaged and that is imported if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it is graded and labelled in accordance with the requirements, in respect of grades of beef carcasses, that are established by the foreign state of origin, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: it is accompanied by documents for presentation to an inspector or grader that show the grade designation that is established by the foreign state of origin; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a beef carcass, or a carcass side, hind quarter, front quarter, primal cut or sub-primal cut of a beef carcass, that is not prepackaged and does not bear a grade name, and that is sent or conveyed from one province to another, if it is accompanied by documents, for presentation to an inspector or grader, that show its grade name.

Section.Text: The following foods for which grades are prescribed by these Regulations, if they are graded and sent or conveyed from one province to another, or imported or exported, must meet the requirements that are set out in the Compendium or the Grades Document in respect of the applicable grade of that food and must be labelled, in accordance with the Compendium or Grades Document, with the applicable grade name that is set out in the Compendium or Grades Document:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a food referred to in paragraphs 306(2)(a), (c) and (d);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a dairy product, except for a dairy product that is exported;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a bison carcass, ovine carcass or veal carcass; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a poultry carcass that is dressed or partially dressed.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), a licence holder is authorized to apply a grade name to, and use a grade name in connection with, a food that is identified in their licence if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the requirements of paragraphs 8(1)(a) to (d);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the requirements that are set out in the Compendium or the Grades Document in respect of the applicable grade of that food;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food complies with any standards that are set out in the Standards of Identity Document;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a dairy product, an egg, fish, a processed fruit or vegetable product, honey or maple syrup, the food has been graded by a licence holder;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a livestock carcass or poultry carcass that is dressed or partially dressed, the food has been graded by a grader; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the food is packaged and labelled in accordance with these Regulations.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a livestock carcass or a poultry carcass that is dressed or partially dressed, only the persons who are referred to in the Compendium or the Grades Document are authorized, under the circumstances set out in the Compendium or the Grades Document, to apply a grade name to, or use a grade name in connection with, a food in accordance with this Part.

Section.MarginalNote: Imported foods — no prescribed grade name
Section.Text: A food that is imported and in respect of which no grade name is prescribed by these Regulations may be labelled with the grade designation that is established by the foreign state of origin if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food meets the requirements for the grade designation that are established by that foreign state;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the food is labelled in accordance with these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of that foreign state of origin is clearly indicated on the label.

Section.Text: The following persons are authorized to reproduce a grade name:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: printers of labels or manufacturers of packages, if the labels or packages that bear the grade name are provided to a person who is authorized to apply or use the grade name under section 308;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: publishers of documents on the subject of a food that is graded;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: publishers of documents that advertise a food that is graded; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: manufacturers of grade stamp applicators or grade rollers, if the grade stamps applicators or grade rollers are provided to a grader.

Section.Text: Any person is authorized to use a grade name in the advertising or sale of a food if the food is labelled with the grade name in accordance with these Regulations.

Section.MarginalNote: Labelling of grade name — consumer prepackaged food
Section.Text: In the case of a consumer prepackaged food, the grade name must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on the principal display panel or in the manner set out in the Compendium; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in characters of the height that is required by another provision in this Division or, if there is no such provision, in characters of at least the minimum character height that is set out in column 2 of Schedule 6 for the area of a principal display surface that is set out in column 1.

Section.Text: A grade name that is applied to a beef carcass, bison carcass, ovine carcass, veal carcass, poultry carcass that is dressed or partially dressed, dairy product or egg must be shown as illustrated in the Compendium or the Grades Document.

Subsection.Text: The grade name on prepackaged eggs must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton, on the top of the tray or egg carton; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a container, other than a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton, in a central location on the container, except the top or the bottom.

Subsection.Text: The grade name is not required to be shown on trays with an overwrap or on egg cartons that are packaged inside of a second container if the grade name is shown on the second container and the second container is sent or conveyed to an establishment where eggs are graded, packaged and labelled by a licence holder.

If consumer prepackaged eggs in a container other than a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton are packaged inside of a second container, the grade name is not required to be shown on the second container if the grade name is easily visible and legible without opening the second container and the grade name is not obscured by the second container.

Section.Text: The grade name on prepackaged eggs must be shown in characters that are at least the following height:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton of eggs graded Canada A or Canada B, 1.5 mm for the word “Canada” and 3 mm for “A” or “B”;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton of eggs graded Canada C or Canada Nest Run, 1.5 mm;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a container, other than a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton, that contains eggs graded Canada A or Canada B, 6 mm for the word “Canada” and 13 mm for “A” or “B”; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a container, other than a tray with an overwrap or an egg carton, that contains eggs graded Canada C or Canada Nest Run, 13 mm.

Section.Text: Eggs that are graded Canada A must be labelled with any applicable size designation that is set out in the Compendium. The size designation must be shown on the container in close proximity to the grade name.

Prepackaged fish that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or that is imported or exported must be labelled with any applicable class and size designation that is set out in the Compendium. The class name or size designation must be shown in close proximity to the grade name and in characters that are at least 3.2 mm in height.

If consumer prepackaged fish that is labelled in accordance with these Regulations is placed inside of a second container and the resulting product is consumer prepackaged fish, the second container is not required to be labelled with the grade name.
The grade name of prepackaged fish must be shown in characters that are at least 3.2 mm in height if the declaration of net quantity is 900 g or less.

Section.MarginalNote: Grade name — prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables

Subsection.Text: The grade name of prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, other than consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on any surface of the container, except the bottom; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in characters of at least the minimum character height that is set out in column 2 of Schedule 6 for the area of a principal display surface that is set out in column 1.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), the grade name of prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, other than consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, may, if the container is a reusable plastic container, be in characters that are at least 1.6 mm in height.

If prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables that are labelled in accordance with these Regulations are placed inside of a second container and the resulting product is prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, other than consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, the second container is not required to be labelled with the grade name if the grade name is easily visible and legible without having to open the second container and the grade name is not obscured by the second container.

Section.Text: Fresh fruits or vegetables that are sent or conveyed from one province to another or imported must be labelled with the applicable size designation that is set out in the Compendium, if any. The size designation must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be shown in close proximity to the grade name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, other than consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if their container is a reusable plastic container, be shown in characters that are at least 1.6 mm in height, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if their container is not a reusable plastic container, be shown in characters of at least the minimum character height that is set out in paragraph 320(1)(b) for the grade name; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of consumer prepackaged fresh fruits or vegetables, be shown in characters of at least the minimum character height that is set out in column 2 of Schedule 6 for the area of a principal display surface that is set out in column 1.

Subsection.Text: A processed fruit or vegetable product that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or that is imported or exported must be labelled with any applicable size designation that is set out in the Compendium. The size designation must be shown in close proximity to the grade name in characters that are at least 1.6 mm in height.

Despite subsection (1), green or wax beans, peas, lima beans, asparagus tips or spears, whole white potatoes, whole carrots or cut carrots-whole style that are in a hermetically sealed package and have not been size graded or that are not all of the same size may be labelled, as the case may be, with the expression

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: “Ungraded as to Size” or “non calibré”; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: “Assorted Sizes” or “grosseurs assorties” or “Mixed Sizes” or “grosseurs mixtes”.

Section.Text: The grade name of prepackaged honey, other than consumer prepackaged honey, must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: on at least one side or one end of the container; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in characters that are at least 9.5 mm in height.

Section.Text: Honey that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or that is imported or exported must be labelled with any applicable colour class that is set out in the Compendium. The colour class must be shown on the container, in close proximity to the grade name,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of consumer prepackaged honey, in characters that are of at least the minimum character height that is set out in column 2 of Schedule 6 for the area of a principal display surface that is set out in column 1; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of prepackaged honey other than consumer prepackaged honey, in the manner set out in paragraphs 323(a) and (b).

Section.Text: Maple syrup that is graded Canada Grade A and is sent or conveyed from one province to another or exported, or that is graded Grade A and is imported, must be labelled with the applicable colour class that is set out in the Compendium. The colour class must be shown on the container in characters of at least the minimum character height that is set out in column 2 of Schedule 6 for the area of a principal display surface that is set out in column 1.
A grade name that is applied to a prepackaged primal cut or sub-primal cut of a beef carcass must correspond to the grade of the beef carcass from which it is cut.
A cut from a beef carcass that is graded Canada AAA and that is exported in a container may be labelled with the expression “Canada Choice” or “Choix Canada” instead of the grade name.

Subsection.Text: A grade stamp, roller brand or yield stamp must not be removed from a livestock carcass or a primal cut of a livestock carcass unless the removal is at the direction of and under the supervision of a grader or the livestock carcass or primal cut is being trimmed for further processing.
If fat that is marked with a grade stamp, roller brand or yield stamp is removed from a livestock carcass or a primal cut, the fat must be disposed of under a grader’s supervision unless the fat is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: reapplied to the same livestock carcass or primal cut from which it was removed; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: applied, under a grader’s supervision, to another livestock carcass or primal cut that bears the same grade stamp, roller brand or yield stamp.

Subsection.Text: If the carcass referred to in paragraph (2)(b) is a beef carcass that is graded Canada A, Canada AA, Canada AAA or Canada Prime, the fat must be applied to the rib of the carcass.

Section.Text: A livestock carcass or primal cut of a livestock carcass that is marked with a grade stamp, roller brand or yield stamp may bear another mark only if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the mark is shown no more than once on the livestock carcass or once on each primal cut;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the mark is shown alone or in combination with a date;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the size in height and width of the mark or, if a date is shown, of the mark and date in combination does not exceed 76 mm; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the mark and any date do not touch the grade stamp, the roller brand or the yield stamp.

Subsection.Text: The grade name of a poultry carcass must be shown

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a poultry carcass that is individually packaged, on the part of the package that lies on or over the anterior centre of the breast of the poultry; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a poultry carcass that is not individually packaged, on a tag that is attached to the V of the wishbone of the carcass.

Subsection.Text: The grade name of a poultry carcass must be shown in characters that are

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of poultry carcass that is not individually packaged or is in a container labelled “not for further processing” or « aucune transformation ultérieure » and individually wrapped, at least 1.5 mm in height;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a consumer prepackaged poultry carcass graded Canada A or Canada C that has a net weight of 1 kg or less, at least 3 mm in height;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a consumer prepackaged poultry carcass graded Canada A or Canada C that has a net weight of more than 1 kg but not more than 5 kg, at least 6 mm in height;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a consumer prepackaged poultry carcass graded Canada A or Canada C that has a net weight of more than 5 kg, at least 9 mm in height;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a consumer prepackaged poultry carcass graded Canada Utility that has a net weight of 5 kg or less, at least 3 mm in height;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a consumer prepackaged poultry carcass graded Canada Utility that has a net weight of more than 5 kg, at least 5 mm in height; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a prepackaged poultry carcass, other than a consumer prepackaged poultry carcass, at least 6 mm in height.

Section.Text: Only graded poultry carcasses that are dressed or partially dressed and that have the same common name may be packaged in the same container.

Heading.Label: DIVISION 5
Heading.TitleText: Conditions for Grading of Certain Foods

Subsection.Text: A licence holder may grade an egg only if the egg

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is edible;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: does not emit an abnormal odour;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is not mouldy;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has not been in an incubator;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: does not have any internal defect; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: is of a usual colour.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(e), a licence holder may grade and apply the grade name Canada C to an egg that has a particle of the oviduct or a blood spot neither of which exceeds 3 mm in diameter.

Ungraded eggs that are received at an establishment where eggs are graded by a licence holder must be graded and labelled with the applicable grade name that is set out in the Compendium or, if they do not meet the requirements in respect of any grade that are set out in these Regulations, they must be rejected.
Eggs that are rejected must be destroyed or be placed in a container that is labelled with the words “Rejects” and “rejetés”.

Section.Text: A grader may grade a livestock carcass in an establishment that is identified in a licence or in a provincial establishment if one of the following persons has requested in writing that the carcass be graded:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: any person who is in authority in the establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any producer; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person who is in possession of the livestock carcass.

Section.Text: A grader may grade a livestock carcass if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass bears a meat inspection stamp or, in the case of an imported beef carcass, the official inspection mark of the foreign state of origin;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the grading takes place

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a bison carcass or ovine carcass, in the establishment that is identified in a licence, or the provincial establishment, where the animal was slaughtered,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a veal carcass, in the establishment that is identified in a licence, or the provincial establishment, where the animal was slaughtered or where the carcass was divided into primal cuts or sub-primal cuts, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a beef carcass, in the establishment that is identified in a licence, or the provincial establishment, where the animal was slaughtered or in the establishment that is identified in a licence where the carcass was divided into primal cuts or sub-primal cuts;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass has been weighed by a weighmaster using a scale that is approved under section 3 of the Weights and Measures Act;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass is presented for grading

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: at a grading stand where the lighting intensity, measured at the level of the grading stand, is at least 1 000 lx, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a cooler where the lighting intensity, measured at the loin level of the carcass, is at least 200 lx;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: at least 10 minutes before grading,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a beef carcass or bison carcass, an employee of the establishment performs, to the satisfaction of the grader, a knife-rib on the carcass, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a veal carcass, an employee of the establishment performs, to the satisfaction of the grader, a cut on the lean of the brisket to enable the grader to determine the colour reading of the veal carcass;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the establishment has adequate equipment and facilities for weighing and grading livestock carcasses; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the grading equipment is functioning properly and is accurate.

Subsection.Text: If more than 400 livestock carcasses are graded per hour in an establishment that is identified in a licence or in a provincial establishment, more than one grading stand is required for the purposes of paragraph 335(f).
For the purposes of paragraph 335(f), a grading stand must be easily adjustable for height and must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the rate of grading is 150 carcasses per hour or less, be at least 3 m long and 2 m wide;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the rate of grading is more than 150 carcasses per hour but not more than 300 carcasses per hour, be at least 4 m long and 2 m wide; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the rate of grading is more than 300 carcasses per hour, be at least 5 m long and 2 m wide.

Section.Text: A livestock carcass that is graded must be weighed before it is trimmed, unless an inspector or grader directs that it be trimmed before it is weighed.

Subsection.Text: A grader may grade a poultry carcass that has been dressed if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass is from poultry slaughtered in an establishment that is identified in a licence or in a provincial establishment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass has been inspected under the Act or under an Act of a province that regulates the inspection of poultry carcasses;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a chilled poultry carcass, the flesh or skin is not dried out;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass is not discoloured from insufficient bleeding;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass has no more than one heart, liver, gizzard and neck packed with it or inserted into it;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a poultry carcass that weighs more than 900 g, the breast bone is intact; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass has not been basted or stuffed.

Subsection.MarginalNote: Conditions for grading — partially dressed carcass
Subsection.Text: A grader may grade a poultry carcass that has been partially dressed if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass meets the requirements that are set out in paragraphs (1)(a) to (g);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the carcass has been eviscerated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the epidermis has been removed from the feet and shanks;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the claws have been removed;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the head, if present, is wrapped; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the beak, if present, is clean.

Subsection.Text: A poultry carcass must not be graded in any place other than in an establishment that is identified in a licence or in a provincial establishment.

A grader — or a licence holder, the operator of a provincial establishment or a marketing agency under the direction of a grader — may issue a grading certificate in respect of a livestock carcass or a lot of livestock carcasses if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: at the time of delivery of the food animal or lot of food animals to an establishment that is identified in a licence or to a provincial establishment for slaughter, the producer has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: requested the certificate in writing,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: identified each animal that is intended to be slaughtered with an identification code, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: completed and filed with any person who is in authority in the establishment a list that associates each identification code with the producer; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: after slaughter, the identification code of each slaughtered animal is retained on or transferred to the livestock carcass by any person who is in authority in the establishment.

Subsection.Text: The grading certificate must be signed by the grader and include the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the producer;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name of any person who is acting on behalf of the producer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the establishment where the livestock carcasses were graded;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate number;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the date of slaughter;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for each livestock carcass,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its identification code,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its warm weight as determined by a weighmaster, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its grade;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a lot of livestock carcasses,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of livestock carcasses per grade or per yield class, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of livestock carcasses that have been condemned;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a grading certificate that is issued in respect of a beef carcass that is graded Canada A, Canada AA, Canada AAA or Canada Prime, the yield of the beef carcass;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a grading certificate that is issued in respect of a beef carcass or bison carcass, an indication, for each carcass, of its age, meat colour, firmness, and, if any,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its musculature,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its marbling, specifically, the amount, size and distribution of intramuscular fat deposits in the longissimus muscles,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its fat colour or texture,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: its fat measurement, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: its pronounced masculinity;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a grading certificate that is issued in respect of a lamb carcass, as defined in the Compendium, for each carcass,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the fat measurement,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the score for musculature of each primal cut and the average score for musculature,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a carcass that is graded Canada AAA, the yield, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an indication of any musculature demerits, meat colour demerits or fat colour demerits that were assigned to the carcass; and

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a grading certificate that is issued in respect of a mutton carcass, as defined in the Compendium, the fat measurement of the carcass.

Subsection.Text: The information referred to in subsection (2) may be recorded on the grading certificate by the licence holder, the operator or the marketing agency referred to in subsection (1).

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this Part.

Definition.Text: aquaculture product has the same meaning as in CAN/CGSB-32.312. (produit aquacole)

CAN/CGSB-32.310 means the Canadian General Standards Board standard CAN/CGSB-32.310, entitled Organic production systems — General principles and management standards, as amended from time to time. (norme CAN/CGSB-32.310)

CAN/CGSB-32.311 means the Canadian General Standards Board standard CAN/CGSB-32.311, entitled Organic production systems — Permitted substances lists, as amended from time to time. (norme CAN/CGSB-32.311)

CAN/CGSB-32.312 means the Canadian General Standards Board standard CAN/CGSB-32.312, entitled Organic production systems — Aquaculture — General principles, management standards and permitted substances lists, as amended from time to time. (norme CAN/CGSB-32.312)

certification body means any person who is accredited as a certification body under section 361 or 363 and who is responsible for the organic certification of food commodities and for the certification of packaging or labelling of organic products. (organisme de certification)

conformity verification body means any person who, having complied with the requirements that are set out in ISO/IEC 17011, has entered into an agreement with the Agency under subsection 14(1) of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency Act to assess, recommend for accreditation and monitor certification bodies. (organisme de vérification de la conformité)

ISO/IEC 17011 means the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO/IEC 17011, entitled Conformity assessment — General requirements for accreditation bodies accrediting conformity assessment bodies, as amended from time to time. (norme ISO/IEC 17011)

ISO/IEC 17065 means the International Organization for Standardization standard ISO/IEC 17065, entitled Conformity assessment — Requirements for bodies certifying products, processes and services, as amended from time to time. (norme ISO/IEC 17065)

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (c) of the definition food commodity in section 2 of the Act, the following are prescribed food commodities:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: feed as defined in section 2 of the Feeds Act; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: seed as defined in section 2 of the Seeds Act.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(a), a reference to “livestock” in the definition feed in section 2 of the Feeds Act must be read to include livestock that is an aquaculture product.

A food commodity that is not included in paragraph (a) or (b) of the definition food commodity in section 2 of the Act is exempted from the application of any provision of the Act and of these Regulations that is not necessary to give effect to this Part. For greater certainty, the exemption does not include section 6 of the Act.

Section.Text: The packaging and labelling of an organic product that is to be sent or conveyed from one province to another may only be conducted by a person who holds a certificate that is granted under section 345 or 348.

Section.MarginalNote: Determination of percentage of organic products
Section.Text: The percentage of the contents of a multi-ingredient food commodity that are organic products must be determined in accordance with CAN/CGSB-32.310.

Subsection.Text: Any person who wishes to obtain the organic certification of a food commodity must apply in writing to a certification body.
The application must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the food commodity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that sets out the substances and materials that are used to conduct any activities with respect to the food commodity and that describes the manner in which those substances and materials are used;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document that sets out in detail the methods that are used by the applicant, or by a person acting on behalf of the applicant, to conduct any activities with respect to the food commodity and the control mechanisms that are in place to ensure that those methods meet the requirements that are set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a person packages and labels the food commodity on behalf of the applicant, the name of the person and a copy of the certificate referred to in subsection 348(2) that they hold; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a multi-ingredient food commodity, a statement that sets out its composition and the percentage of its contents that are organic products.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an application for the organic certification of a food commodity, the application must be filed within 12 months before the day on which the food commodity is expected to be sold or, in the case of an application for the organic certification of any of the following food commodities, at least 15 months before that day:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maple products;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: field crops or crops that are grown in greenhouses with an in-ground permanent soil system;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: wild crops within the meaning of CAN/CGSB-32.312; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: aquaculture products with a production cycle of more than 12 months.

Subsection.Text: A certification body must conduct an on-site verification and certify a food commodity as organic if it determines that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the substances and materials that are used to conduct activities in respect of the food commodity are set out and used in the manner described

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310 or CAN/CGSB-32.311;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the methods that are used by the applicant, or by a person acting on behalf of the applicant, to conduct activities in respect of the food commodity and the control mechanisms that are in place meet the requirements and comply with the general principles respecting organic production that are set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where a person packages and labels the food commodity on behalf of the applicant, the person holds a certificate referred to in subsection 348(2);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a multi-ingredient food commodity, at least 70% of its contents are organic products and its composition meets the requirements that are set out in CAN/CGSB-32.310; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the information submitted in the application is complete, truthful and not misleading.

Subsection.Text: The certification body must provide the applicant with a certificate that confirms the organic certification of the food commodity and that indicates the name of the food commodity, whether CAN/CGSB‑32.310 or CAN/CGSB‑32.312 is applicable, and, in the case of a multi-ingredient food commodity, whether at least 70% of its contents are organic products or whether at least 95% of its contents are organic products.

The holder of the certificate referred to in subsection 345(2) must provide to the certification body the information that is set out in subsection 344(2) once every 12‑month period beginning on the day on which the certificate is issued and no later than the day that is six months before the end of that period.

After receiving the information from the certificate holder under subsection (1), the certification body must, no later than the end of the 12‑month period referred to in that subsection, conduct an on-site verification to determine whether the requirements that are set out in subsection 345(1) are met.

Any person who wishes to package or label an organic product, other than a product in respect of which they hold a certificate granted under section 345, must apply in writing to a certification body for certification of the activity.
The application must include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an indication of the type of organic product;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that sets out the substances and materials that the applicant will use to package or label the organic product and that describes the manner in which those substances and materials will be used; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a document that sets out in detail the methods that the applicant will use to package or label the organic product and the control mechanisms that the applicant will put in place to ensure that those methods meet the requirements that are set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310.

Subsection.Text: A certification body must conduct an on-site verification and certify the activity in respect of the packaging or labelling of an organic product if it determines that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the substances and materials that are used by the applicant for packaging or labelling are set out and used in the manner described

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310 or CAN/CGSB-32.311;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the methods that are used by the applicant for packaging or labelling and the control mechanisms that are in place meet the requirements and comply with the general principles respecting organic production that are set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310.

Subsection.Text: The certification body must provide the applicant with a certificate that confirms the certification of the packaging or labelling of the organic product and that indicates the type of organic product to which it applies and the period of validity referred to in subsection (3).
The certification of the packaging or labelling of an organic product is valid for 12 months beginning on the day on which it is granted under subsection (1).
Subject to subsection (2), the certification body must suspend a certification that is granted under section 345 or 348 if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the certificate does not comply with any provision of the Act or this Part;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the substances or materials that are used are other than those that are set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310 or CAN/CGSB-32.311;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the food commodity comes into contact with a substance or material other than one that is set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310 or CAN/CGSB-32.311;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the substances or materials that are used are set out but are not used in the manner described,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310 or CAN/CGSB-32.311;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the methods that are used do not meet the requirements or do not comply with the general principles respecting organic production that are set out

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.312, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, in CAN/CGSB-32.310; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a multi-ingredient food commodity, less than 70% of its contents are organic products.

Subsection.Text: The certification body must not suspend a certification unless the holder of the certificate

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was provided with a written report that sets out the grounds for the suspension and the period within which corrective action must be taken in order to avoid the suspension; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: failed to take corrective action within that period or, if the certification body granted an extension at the written request of the holder, within any later period specified by the certification body.

Subsection.Text: The certification body may grant an extension of the period in which corrective action must be taken only once.
The certification body must notify the holder of the certificate in writing of the suspension and the date on which it takes effect.
The suspension of a certification must be lifted if the certification body determines that corrective action has been taken.
The certification body must cancel a certification if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the certificate fails to take corrective action within 30 days after the day on which the certification was suspended;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the certificate was not in compliance with section 15 of the Act in respect of the application made under section 344 or 347 or at any time during the period of validity of the certification; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: while the certification is suspended,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a certification that was granted under section 345, the holder of the certificate

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: sends or conveys from one province to another a food commodity that is labelled with an expression that is referred to in subsection 353(1) or (2),

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: sends or conveys from one province to another a food commodity that has on it the product legend that is set out in Schedule 9 or a food commodity in connection with which that product legend is used,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: applies or attaches to a food commodity a label that bears an expression that is referred to in subsection 353(1) or (2) or uses such an expression in the advertisement of a food commodity,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: applies the product legend that is set out in Schedule 9 to, or uses it in connection with, a food commodity, or

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: conducts any activity with respect to a food commodity that is identified in the certificate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a certification that was granted under section 348, the holder of the certificate packages or labels an organic product.

Subsection.Text: The certification body must not cancel a certification unless the holder of the certificate was notified in writing of the grounds for the cancellation and was provided with an opportunity to be heard in respect of the cancellation.
The certification body must notify the holder of the certificate in writing of the cancellation and the date on which it takes effect.

Section.Text: The holder of a certificate must prepare, keep and maintain the documents that are set out in the following standards, in accordance with those standards:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an aquaculture product, CAN/CGSB-32.312; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity other than an aquaculture product, CAN/CGSB-32.310.

Section.Text: The holder of a certificate must immediately notify the certification body in writing of any change that could affect the certification and of any complaint that they receive in relation to the organic integrity of the organic product referred to in the certification.

Subsection.Text: The expressions “organic” or “biologique” or “organique”, “organically grown” or “cultivé biologiquement”, “organically raised” or “élevé biologiquement” and “organically produced” or “produit biologiquement” and any similar expressions, including abbreviations of, symbols for and phonetic renderings of those expressions, may be shown on the label or used in the advertisement of a food commodity that is sent or conveyed from one province to another if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the food commodity is an organic product; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a multi-ingredient food commodity, at least 95% of its contents are organic products.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), if a multi-ingredient food commodity is an organic product but less than 95% of its contents are organic products, it may be labelled with or advertised using the expression “organic ingredients” or “d’ingrédients biologiques” if that expression is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: immediately preceded by the percentage of its contents that are organic products, rounded down to the nearest whole number; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in characters of the same height and prominence as the words, numbers, signs or symbols that indicate that percentage.

Subsection.Text: Despite subsection (1), the list of ingredients that is shown on the label of a multi-ingredient food commodity that is not an organic product may indicate which of the ingredients are organic products.

Section.Text: If an expression that is referred to in subsection 353(1) or (2) is shown on the label of a food commodity, the label must also bear

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity that is sent or conveyed from one province to another, the name of the certification body that certified the food commodity as organic;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity that is imported, the name of the certification body or the name of the entity accredited by a foreign state referred to in subparagraph 357(1)(a)(ii) or (iii) that certified the food commodity as organic;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a multi-ingredient food commodity that is sent or conveyed from one province to another or that is imported, the organic contents that are identified as organic in its list of ingredients; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a food commodity that is imported and on whose label the product legend that is set out in Schedule 9 is applied, the expression “Product of” or “produit de” immediately preceding the name of the foreign state of origin or the word “Imported” or “importé” in close proximity to that product legend.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the expressions that are referred to in subsections 353(1) and (2) and paragraph 354(d) and the information that is referred to in paragraph 354(c) must be shown on the label of a food commodity in both official languages.
